text.p: Swiss pharmaceuticals group Roche Holding AG said its 1996 net profit was expected to show another rise due to higher operating profits and good results from its non-operating business.
On October 15, 1996 Roche also forecast another rise in its 1996 profit.
Roche had a 1995 group net profit of 3.37 billion Swiss francs.
During 1996 Roche said significant gains in sales volumes helped it expand its position in important sectors and markets despite sustained price pressures.
Sales of its leading products continued to grow and new products were very well received in the market.
Capacity utilisation at its plants continued to rise and coupled with steady gains in efficiency, this helped operating profits show another rise.
"Taking into account another good result for the group's non-operating activities as well, Roche expects to see consolidated net income increase once again," Roche said in a statement.
